title: Kazakhstan Says Russia to Withdraw Troops in Wake of Unrest
sub_head: More than 2,000 troops from Russia, other former Soviet states have been in Kazakhstan to help extinguish protests
body:
MOSCOWâ€”Russia-led forces that entered Kazakhstan to support the embattled government following an eruption of protests would start withdrawing within two days, the Kazakh president said Tuesday as he named a loyalist as prime minister.
President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev said the mission of the troops had been fulfilled and a stage-by-stage pullout of contingents of the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a military alliance that includes several former Soviet states, would take no more than 10 days.
